title: Good Egyptienne
content:
I am searching for a good [Egyptienne](http://web.archive.org/web/20071023164109/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Egyptienne) which has many weights.

Have anyone an idea.

 [‹ Touchy Kerning](http://web.archive.org/web/20071023164109/http:/typophile.com/node/15727 "Go to previous forum topic") [Distressed/Letterpress typeface ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071023164109/http:/typophile.com/node/15741 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Timm

comments.content: Thanks Sebastian. I knew “The Serif” but it doesn’t work well for this job. I like Egytienne F and it would work but i miss some weights like light und bold italic.

[Farao](http://web.archive.org/web/20071023164109/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/storm/farao/) has just been expanded to a 12-font family. Not necessarily more weights, but more “cuts” (book and text with italic).

Dunno about weights, but Egyptian 505 is the only one I really like.

hhp

oooooh, i hafta say i love Farao, but it’s VERY playful. if you need somehting a bit more stern, you might check out [Giza](http://web.archive.org/web/20071023164109/http:/fontbureau.com/fonts/Giza) or another Typophile favorite: [Oxtail](http://web.archive.org/web/20071023164109/http:/www.psyops.com/html/spec_oxtail.html).

And how is the font Serifa: [http://www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=Serifa](http://web.archive.org/web/20071023164109/http:/www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=Serifa "http://www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=Serifa")
